meanings.definition: A person or thing that shunts or moves something from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: The shunter quickly moved the boxes to the other side of the room.
meanings.sent2: The factory had a reliable shunter to transfer goods between departments.
meanings.sent3: The little robot acted as a shunter, zipping around the warehouse with ease.
meanings.sent4: Her hands were like skilled shunters, effortlessly rearranging the items on the shelves.
meanings.sent5: The shunter, a helpful assistant, made the task of relocating items a breeze.

meanings.definition: A railway employee responsible for moving trains or carriages in a yard.
meanings.sent1: The shunter guided the train safely into the station.
meanings.sent2: The experienced shunter efficiently directed the carriages along the tracks.
meanings.sent3: The shunter's job was to make sure the trains played a game of musical chairs.
meanings.sent4: The shunter orchestrated the dance of the carriages with precision and skill.
meanings.sent5: Every morning, the shunter greeted the trains with a wave, ready to start the day's work.

meanings.definition: A device used to move railway carriages from one track to another.
meanings.sent1: The shunter smoothly transferred the carriages to the correct track.
meanings.sent2: The old shunter had been in use for decades, aiding in the smooth operation of the railway yard.
meanings.sent3: The shunter hummed happily as it carried out its duty of track switching.
meanings.sent4: The shiny new shunter gleamed under the sun, ready to assist in the railway operations.
meanings.sent5: With a gentle push, the shunter nudged the carriages onto the right path, ensuring a seamless journey.
